de.akquinet.android.androlog
Class Log

java.lang.Object
  de.akquinet.android.androlog.Log

public class Log
extends Object

Implements a small layer on top of the Android Log to provide programmatic enabling and disabling of logging as well as providing report support

To support wtf methods, Androlog detects if we're on Android 2.2+. If not, the ASSERT level is used.

Log methods returns an integer. This integer is the number of byte written in the log. If a method returns 0, the message was not logged.

Reporting is enabled by defining Reporter objects and activating the reporting. Reporting is supported only if Androlog is initialized with an Android Context.

ANDROLOG_DELEGATE_WTF

public static final String ANDROLOG_DELEGATE_WTF
Property to deactivate the delagation on the Android Log wtf method which may cause the process to terminate. On android 2.2, this property allow to disable this delegation. Androlog then just log an ASSERT message.

See Also:

setWTFDelegation

public static boolean setWTFDelegation(boolean delegation)
Enables or disables the delegation to the Android log wtf methods. Those methods when present (android 2.2+) may cause the termination of the application.

Parameters:
delegation - enables or disables the delegation
Returns:
if the delegation is enabled. Indeed, on 1.6 and 2.0 it can't be enabled.

reset

public static void reset()
Resets the configuration.

init

public static void init(String fileName)
Androlog init method. This method uses the Android API. Inits the logger by reading the file: /SDCARD/fileName. The file must be a valid Java properties file.

Parameters:
fileName - the file name

init

public static void init(android.content.Context context)
Androlog init method. This method uses the Android API. This methods computes the package (Context.getPackageName()) of the application configuring the logger, and initializes the logger with a property file named 'package.properties' on the SDCARD or in the application assets (if the file cannot be found on the SDCard). If the file is readable and exist, the Log is configured. The file must be a valid Java properties file.

See Also:
Properties

init

public static void init()
Androlog init method. This method uses the Android API. It reads the ANDROLOG_PROPERTIES file on the SDCARD. If the file is readable and exist, the Log is configured. The file must be a valid Java properties file.

See Also:
Properties

init

public static void init(android.content.Context context,
                        String fileName)
Androlog Init Method. This method loads the Androlog Configuration from:
  1. /SDCARD/fileName if the file name if not null
  2. /SDCARD/Application_Package.properties if the file name is null and context is not null
  3. Application_Assets/fileName if the file name if not null and the context is not null
  4. Application_Assets/Application_Package.properties if the file name is null and the context is not null
The first found file is used, allowing overriding the configuration by just pushing a file on the SDCard. Passing null to both parameters is equivalent to the case 2. If the lookup failed, the logging is disabled.

Parameters:
context - the application context
fileName - the file name

wtf

public static int wtf(String tag,
                      String msg)
What a Terrible Failure: Report a condition that should never happen. The error will always be logged at level ASSERT despite the logging is disabled. Depending on system configuration, and on Android 2.2+, a report may be added to the DropBoxManager and/or the process may be terminated immediately with an error dialog. On older Android version (before 2.2), the message is logged with the Assert level. Those log messages will always be logged.

Parameters:
tag - Used to identify the source of a log message. It usually identifies the class or activity where the log call occurs.
msg - The message you would like logged.

wtf

public static int wtf(String tag,
                      Throwable tr)
What a Terrible Failure: Report a condition that should never happen. The error will always be logged at level ASSERT despite the logging is disabled. Depending on system configuration, and on Android 2.2+, a report may be added to the DropBoxManager and/or the process may be terminated immediately with an error dialog. On older Android version (before 2.2), the message is logged with the Assert level. Those log messages will always be logged.

Parameters:
tag - Used to identify the source of a log message. It usually identifies the class or activity where the log call occurs.
tr - The exception to log

isLoggable

public static boolean isLoggable(String tag,
                                 int level)
Checks to see whether or not a log for the specified tag is loggable at the specified level. The default level of any tag is set as specified in setDefaultLogLevel(int). This means that any level above and including that level will be logged. Use configure(Properties) to define different log levels for each tag.

Parameters:
tag - The tag to check.
level - The level to check.
Returns:
Whether or not that this is allowed to be logged.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - is thrown if the tag.length() > 23.

isReportable

public static boolean isReportable(int level)
Checks to see whether or not a log is reportable at the specified level. The default level of any tag is set as specified in setDefaultReportLevel(int). This means that any level above and including that level will be logged.

Parameters:
level - The level to check.
Returns:
Whether or not that this is allowed to be reported.

isLoggable

public static boolean isLoggable(Object object,
                                 int level)
Checks to see whether or not a log for the specified object is loggable at the specified level. The tag is computed from the given object (qualified class name).

Parameters:
object - the object.
level - the level to check.
Returns:
Whether or not that this is allowed to be logged.

Parameters:
tr - An exception to log

public static int println(int priority,
                          String tag,

Low-level logging call.

Parameters:

Returns:

report

public static boolean report()
Triggers a report without message and error

Returns:
true if the report was successfully sent by all reporters, false otherwise.

report

public static boolean report(String message,
                             Throwable error)
Triggers a Report. This method generates the report and send it with all configured reporters.

Parameters:
message - the message
error - the error
Returns:
true if the report was successfully sent by all reporters, false otherwise.

getReportedEntries

public static List<String> getReportedEntries()
Gets the list of reported entries.

Returns:
a copy of the reported entries or null if no entries were collected.
